user: What is the difference between end-of-line comments and block comments in OpenROAD?
assistant:
The main differences between end-of-line comments and block comments in OpenROAD are:
1. Syntax: End-of-line comments use "//" while block comments use "/*" and "*/".
2. Span: End-of-line comments are typically used for single lines, while block comments can easily span
   multiple lines.
3. Usage: End-of-line comments are often used for brief explanations or to comment out single lines of code,
   while block comments are useful for longer explanations or commenting out larger blocks of code.

user: How can you comment out a partial line of code in OpenROAD?
assistant:
You can comment out a partial line of code in OpenROAD by using an end-of-line comment. Simply add "//"
after the code you want to keep, and the rest of the line will be treated as a comment. For example:
insert into employees(salary, age) // This part will be executed
values(:salfield, :agefield); // This is a comment
